passages.text: What you seek is seeking you.
passages.context: The search for meaning is not one-directional. The universe conspires toward connection.

passages.text: The wound is the place where the Light enters you.
passages.context: Pain creates openings. What feels like destruction can become the entry point for grace.

passages.text: Out beyond ideas of wrongdoing and rightdoing, there is a field. I'll meet you there. When the soul lies down in that grass, the world is too full to talk about. Ideas, language, even the phrase 'each other' doesn't make any sense.
passages.context: Moral categories are provisional. There is a place beyond judgment where true meeting happens.

passages.text: I have lived on the lip of insanity, wanting to know reasons, knocking on a door. It opens. I've been knocking from the inside.
passages.context: The search for truth often reveals we already possessed what we sought. The door was never locked from our side.

passages.text: Don't grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form.
passages.context: Nothing is truly lost in the cosmic economy. Forms change, essence circulates.

passages.text: Be like melting snow — wash yourself of yourself.
passages.context: The ego's solidity is illusion. Real freedom comes through dissolving the false self.

passages.text: Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment. Cleverness is mere opinion, bewilderment is intuition.
passages.context: Intellectual certainty can be a prison. True wisdom often begins with admitting we don't know.

passages.text: The morning wind spreads its fresh smell. We must get up and take that in, that wind that lets us live. Breathe before it's gone.
passages.context: Each moment carries unrepeatable gifts. Attention is the practice of receiving them.

passages.text: You are not a drop in the ocean. You are the entire ocean in a drop.
passages.context: The relationship between self and cosmos is not containment but identity. You don't belong to something larger — you ARE the larger expressing itself locally.

passages.text: When I am silent, I have thunder hidden inside.
passages.context: Silence is not emptiness. The deepest forces often move without sound.

passages.text: Let yourself be silently drawn by the strange pull of what you really love. It will not lead you astray.
passages.context: Genuine love — not preference, not attachment — is a compass. Following it requires courage and trust.

passages.text: The lion is most handsome when looking for food.
passages.context: There is beauty in genuine need, in the state of searching. Satiation can make us dull.

passages.text: Set your life on fire. Seek those who fan your flames.
passages.context: Life asks for commitment, for burning. Choose companions who amplify rather than dampen your essential fire.

passages.text: Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world. Today I am wise, so I am changing myself.
passages.context: The desire to fix the external world often precedes the harder work of inner transformation.

passages.text: This being human is a guest house. Every morning a new arrival. A joy, a depression, a meanness, some momentary awareness comes as an unexpected visitor. Welcome and entertain them all!
passages.context: Emotions are visitors, not residents. The practice is welcoming without grasping or rejecting.

passages.text: The art of knowing is knowing what to ignore.
passages.context: Wisdom is as much about what we don't engage as what we do. Not all thoughts deserve response.

passages.text: Don't be satisfied with stories, how things have gone with others. Unfold your own myth.
passages.context: Others' paths illuminate but cannot substitute for your own journey. Each life is unrepeatable.

passages.text: Why do you stay in prison when the door is so wide open?
passages.context: Many prisons are self-constructed. The bars are often made of belief, not steel.

passages.text: Ignore those that make you fearful and sad, that degrade you back towards disease and death.
passages.context: Not all influences deserve access to your inner world. Discernment in relationship is spiritual practice.

passages.text: In your light I learn how to love. In your beauty, how to make poems. You dance inside my chest where no one sees you, but sometimes I do, and that sight becomes this art.
passages.context: Art emerges from glimpses of the divine beloved within. Creativity is witness to inner dance.
